00020 #define  FACE_AUTO_DISPLAY_BUFFER         0xFFFFF000
00021 #define  FACE_AUTO_RESTORE_BUFFER         0xFFFFFF00
00022 #define  FACE_NO_RESTORE_BUFFER                 0xFFFFFFF0

00024 // FLAGS....
00025 #define      FACE_DESTROY_OVERLAY                                             0x00000000                                // A face may contain a video overlay
00026 #define      FACE_BIGFACE                                                                       0x00000001                                // A BIGFACE instead of small face
00027 #define      FACE_POTENTIAL_KEYWAIT                                     0x00000002                                // If the option is set, will not stop face until key pressed
00028 #define      FACE_PCTRIGGER_NPC                                                     0x00000004                                // This face has to trigger an NPC after being done
00029 #define  FACE_INACTIVE_HANDLED_ELSEWHERE        0x00000008                                // This face has been setup and any disable should be done
00030                                                                                                                                                                                                       // Externally
00031 #define      FACE_TRIGGER_PREBATTLE_INT                           0x00000010                                
00032 #define      FACE_SHOW_WHITE_HILIGHT                                    0x00000020                                // Show highlight around face
00033 #define      FACE_FORCE_SMALL                                                       0x00000040                                // force to small face  
00034 #define      FACE_MODAL                                                                         0x00000080                                // make game modal
00035 #define      FACE_MAKEACTIVE_ONCE_DONE                            0x00000100                                
00036 #define  FACE_SHOW_MOVING_HILIGHT                                 0x00000200
00037 #define      FACE_REDRAW_WHOLE_FACE_NEXT_FRAME  0x00000400                                // Redraw the complete face next frame
00038 
00039 #define      FACE_DRAW_TEXT_OVER                      2
00040 #define      FACE_ERASE_TEXT_OVER                     1
00041 #define      FACE_NO_TEXT_OVER                              0

00047 typedef struct audio_gap AUDIO_GAP;
00048 
00049 typedef struct
00050 {
00051   // This is a structure that will contain data about the gaps in a particular
00052       // wave file
00053 
00054   UINT32                            size; /* the number of entries in the list of AUDIO_GAPs itself*/
00055   UINT32                            current_time;
00056   // Pointer to head and current entry of gap list
00057       AUDIO_GAP *pHead;
00058       AUDIO_GAP *pCurrent;
00059   
00060       BOOLEAN                             audio_gap_active;
00061             
00062 } AudioGapList;

00065 typedef struct
00066 {
00067       UINT32            uiFlags;                                                                      // Basic flags 
00068       INT32             iID;
00069       BOOLEAN           fAllocated;                                                             //Allocated or not
00070       BOOLEAN           fTalking;                                                                     //Set to true if face is talking ( can be sitting for user input to esc )
00071       BOOLEAN           fAnimatingTalking;                                          // Set if the face is animating right now
00072       BOOLEAN           fDisabled;                                                              // Not active
00073       BOOLEAN           fValidSpeech;
00074       BOOLEAN           fStartFrame;                                                            // Flag for the first start frame
00075       BOOLEAN           fInvalidAnim;
00076 
00077       UINT32            uiTalkingDuration;                                          // A delay based on text length for how long to talk if no speech
00078       UINT32            uiTalkingTimer;                                                   // A timer to handle delay when no speech file
00079       UINT32            uiTalkingFromVeryBeginningTimer;// Timer from very beginning of talking...    
00080 
00081       BOOLEAN           fFinishTalking;                                                   // A flag to indicate we want to delay after speech done
00082 
00083       INT32             iVideoOverlay;                                                    // Value for video overlay ( not used too much )
00084 
00085       UINT32            uiSoundID;                                                              // Sound ID if one being played

00088

00157 // GLOBAL FOR FACES LISTING
00158 extern FACETYPE   gFacesData[ NUM_FACE_SLOTS ];
00159 
00160 // FACE HANDLING
00161 //
00162 // Faces are done like this: Call
00163 INT32 InitFace( UINT8 usMercProfileID, UINT8 ubSoldierID, UINT32 uiInitFlags );
00164 // The first parameter is the profile ID and the second is the soldier ID ( which for most cases
00165 // will be NOBODY if the face is not created from a SOLDIERTYPE )
00166 // This function allocates a slot in the table for the face, loads it's STI file, sets some
00167 // values for X,Y locations of eyes from the profile. Does not mkae the face visible or anything like that
00168 
00169 // INternal init face, called if you don;t want to give a profile ID ( send NO_PROFILE ) for ID
00170 INT32 InternalInitFace( UINT8 usMercProfileID, UINT8 ubSoldierID, UINT32 uiInitFlags, INT32 iFaceFileID, UINT32 uiBlinkFrequency, UINT32 uiExpressionFrequency );
00171 
00172 
00173 // Removes the face from the internal table, deletes any memory allocated if any.
00174 void DeleteFace( INT32 iFaceIndex );
00175 
00176 // IF you want to setup the face for automatic eye blinking, mouth movement, you need to call
00177 void SetAutoFaceActive( UINT32 uiDisplayBuffer, UINT32 uiRestoreBuffer, INT32 iFaceIndex , UINT16 usFaceX, UINT16 usFaceY );
00178 // The first paramter is the display buffer you wish the face to be rendered on. The second is the
00179 // Internal savebuffer which is used to facilitate the rendering of only things which have changed when
00180 // blinking. IF the value of FACE_AUTO_RESTORE_BUFFER is given, the system will allocate it's own memory for
00181 // a saved buffer and will delete it when finished with it. This function also takes an XY location
00182 
00183 // Same as above, yet used mostly internally. Is compatible with the fact that a soldier profile ID is not required...
00184 void InternalSetAutoFaceActive( UINT32 uiDisplayBuffer, UINT32 uiRestoreBuffer, INT32 iFaceIndex , UINT16 usFaceX, UINT16 usFaceY, UINT16 usEyesX, UINT16 usEyesY, UINT16 usMouthX, UINT16 usMouthY );
00185 
00186 
00187 // To begin rendering of the face sprite, call this function once:
00188 BOOLEAN RenderAutoFace( INT32 iFaceIndex );
00189 // This will draw the face into it's saved buffer and then display it on the display buffer. If the display
00190 // buffer given is FRAME_BUFFER, the regions will automatically be dirtied, so no calls to InvalidateRegion()
00191 // should be nessesary.
00192 
00193 // If you want to setup the face to talking, ( most times this call is done in JA2 by other functions, not
00194 //directly), you call
00195 BOOLEAN SetFaceTalking( INT32 iFaceIndex, CHAR8 *zSoundFile, STR16 zTextString, UINT32 usRate, UINT32 ubVolume, UINT32 ubLoops, UINT32 uiPan );
00196 // This function will setup appropriate face data and begin the speech process. It can fail if the sound 
00197 //cannot be played for any reason.
00198 
00199 // Set some face talking flags without need to play sound
00200 BOOLEAN ExternSetFaceTalking( INT32 iFaceIndex, UINT32 uiSoundID );
00201 
00202 // Once this is done, this function must be called overy gameloop that you want to handle the sprite:
00203 void HandleAutoFaces( );
00204 // This will handle all faces set to be auto mamaged by SetAutoFaceActive(). What is does is determines
00205 // the best mouth and eye graphic to use. It then renders only the rects nessessary into the display buffer.
00206 
00207 // If you need to shutoff the face from talking, use the function
00208 void ShutupaYoFace( INT32 iFaceIndex );
00209 void InternalShutupaYoFace( INT32 iFaceIndex, BOOLEAN fForce );
00210 
00211 // This can be used to times when you need process the user hitting <ESC> to cancel the speech, etc. It will
00212 // shutoff any playing sound sample
00213 
00214 // If you still want the face in moemory but want to stop if from being displayed, or handled call
00215 void SetAutoFaceInActive( INT32 iFaceIndex );
00216 
00217 // To set all currently allocated faces to either active or incactive, call these
00218 void SetAllAutoFacesInactive( );
00219 
00220 // To render an allocated face but one that is indipendent of it's active status, ant does not
00221 // require eye blinking or mouth movements, call
00222 BOOLEAN ExternRenderFace( UINT32 uiBuffer, INT32 iFaceIndex, INT16 sX, INT16 sY );
00223 
00224 // FUnctions usually not needed for most uses, but give a finer control over rendering if needed
00225 void BlinkAutoFace( INT32 iFaceIndex );
00226 void MouthAutoFace( INT32 iFaceIndex );
00227 void HandleTalkingAutoFace( INT32 iFaceIndex );
00228 void HandleTalkingAutoFaces( );
00229

00233 // Same Functions but taking soldier ID first to get profile ID 
00234 INT32       InitSoldierFace( SOLDIERTYPE *pSoldier );
00235 void        DeleteSoldierFace( SOLDIERTYPE *pSoldier );
00236 void        SetAutoFaceActiveFromSoldier( UINT32 uiDisplayBuffer, UINT32 uiRestoreBuffer, UINT8 ubSoldierID , UINT16 usFaceX, UINT16 usFaceY );
00237 void        SetAutoFaceInActiveFromSoldier( UINT8 ubSoldierID );
00238 BOOLEAN RenderAutoFaceFromSoldier( UINT8 ubSoldierID );
00239 BOOLEAN ExternRenderFaceFromSoldier( UINT32 uiBuffer, UINT8 ubSoldierID, INT16 sX, INT16 sY );
